snippet: The National Theater’s production of “This House,” a re-creation of British parliamentary politics in the 1970s, will be shown in a live screening at selected theaters on May 16.
abstract: Ben Brantley maintains that National Theater production of This House, James Graham's play about British House of Commons in 1970s, is much more entertaining than it sounds and recommends attending a screening when it is broadcast to cinemas as part of National Theater Live series.
lead_paragraph: The National Theater’s production of “This House,” a re-creation of British parliamentary politics in the 1970s, will be shown in a live screening at selected theaters on May 16.

headline.print_headline: Wigs and Whips, Songs and Maces, and Legislation, Too
headline.seo: ‘This House,’ by James Graham, to Be Broadcast in Theaters
headline.main: Wigs and Whips, Songs and Maces, and Legislation, Too
